result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis D Walls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Marquis D Walls was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquis D Walls is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Marquis D Walls was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments, provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision. Non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
***Restitution set at $0.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor and may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
NO new law violations rising to the level or probable cause

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS. 
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  2 YEARS,  CONSECUTIVE  to sentence in Racine County 08CF833.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0      
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Trial resumes at 1:35 p.m.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:25 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 3:30 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY on COUNT 1 and GUILTY ON COUNT 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Joint motion on judgment entered on each count of the verdice.   Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED and entry of judgment of conviction on COUNT 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   At the our of 8:35 a.m., Jury Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Wilson P.  Exhibit 1 and 2 offered and received and published to the jury.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Nathan Butz; City of Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Urban; City of Milwaukee Police Officer Ronald Zianik.  Exhibits 3-4 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court conducts collequy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Jury in the box.   Defense rests.  Court excuses Jury for the lunch hour to return at 1:30 p.m. this date for continuation of Jury Trial.   Defense renews motion to dismiss.  Court denies defense motion.  Jury instruction hearing conducted.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:25 p.m.  Preliminary Jury Instructions given by the Court.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn. Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Opening statements by state and defense.  At the hour of 4:35 p.m. Court adjourns matter to June 7, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. for continuation of Jury Trial.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties are prepared for Jury Trial.  Matter passed to 1:30 p.m. this date for commencement of Jury Trial.
Dodge Correctional.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  State places offer on the record.  Defendant rejects offer. Matter to remain calendared for Jury Trial.  Court informed the defendant that after today's date, State does not have to continue negotiations for settlement.
Dodge Correctional.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Marquis D Walls not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Notice of Alibi was filed untimely.  Defendant has the option to keep the currently scheduled Jury Trial date and forego the currently scheduled Jury Trial or adjourn the Jury Trial so that the State can investigate defendant's alibi witnesses.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi Witness received and filed.
Letter from Attorney Eric Hailstock dated March 10, 2016 received and filed.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Marquis D Walls not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced for the final pretrial date.  State to do an Order to Produce for the next court date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in Court for final pre-trial. Attorney Schenfeldt informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable and he is not being paid. Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nathan Butz-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis D Walls in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Marquis D Walls in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
